assessment_steps.step_name: Step 1: Define the disease mechanism
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkin is the causative gene for the autosomal recessive form of Parkinson's disease (PD), and various deletion and point mutations in this gene have been discovered in patients with autosomal recessive juvenile Parkinsonism (AR-JP).
assessment_steps.reasoning: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Uld region in parkin has been reported to bind the Rpn10 subunit of the 26S proteasome. Because Rpn10 is a ubiquitinbinding domain for trapping the polyubiquitinated chain of targeted proteins, it is presumed that the function of Uld is to provide a site for proteasome-mediated protein degradation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The general class of assay used for this variant effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation suggested that the Lys27 N η H…O Leu41 and Lys27 N η H…O δ1 Asn52 pairs in wild Uld are sufficient stable to maintain their hydrogen bonds throughout the MD simulation, although the Lys27 N η H…O Ala38 pair shows an interaction with a relatively large separation (3.8(3) Å) from the usual hydrogen bond distance.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Basic controls and replicates were included for this assay.

assessment_steps.step_name: Sub-step 3c: Variant Controls
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation suggested that the Lys27 N η H…O Leu41 and Lys27 N η H…O δ1 Asn52 pairs in wild Uld are sufficient stable to maintain their hydrogen bonds throughout the MD simulation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Variant controls were not used in the assay for this variant.
assessment_steps.next_step_or_outcome: The functional evidence strength is Max PS3_supporting / Max BS3_supporting

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: The K27N mutation loosens the core structure of Uld and consequently fluctuates the spatial orientation of the periphery of β3 and β4 strands, leading to an impaired proteasomal binding of parkin in AR-JP.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 1: Define the disease mechanism
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkin is the causative gene for the autosomal recessive form of Parkinson's disease (PD), and various deletion and point mutations in this gene have been discovered in patients with autosomal recessive juvenile Parkinsonism (AR-JP).
assessment_steps.reasoning: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Uld region in parkin has been reported to bind the Rpn10 subunit of the 26S proteasome. Because Rpn10 is a ubiquitinbinding domain for trapping the polyubiquitinated chain of targeted proteins, it is presumed that the function of Uld is to provide a site for proteasome-mediated protein degradation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The general class of assay used for this variant effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation suggested that Arg33 is important for stabilizing the backbone structure of the C-terminal side in the α1 helix, because the Arg33 NH…O Val29 pair is almost within their hydrogen bonding distances throughout the MD simulation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Basic controls and replicates were included for this assay.

assessment_steps.step_name: Sub-step 3c: Variant Controls
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation suggested that Arg33 is important for stabilizing the backbone structure of the C-terminal side in the α1 helix.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Variant controls were not used in the assay for this variant.
assessment_steps.next_step_or_outcome: The functional evidence strength is Max PS3_supporting / Max BS3_supporting

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: The R33Q mutation causes the large conformational fluctuation at the Cterminal side of α1 helix, resulting in the spatial instability of the periphery of α1-β3 loop.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 1: Define the disease mechanism
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkin is the causative gene for the autosomal recessive form of Parkinson's disease (PD), and various deletion and point mutations in this gene have been discovered in patients with autosomal recessive juvenile Parkinsonism (AR-JP).
assessment_steps.reasoning: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Uld region in parkin has been reported to bind the Rpn10 subunit of the 26S proteasome. Because Rpn10 is a ubiquitinbinding domain for trapping the polyubiquitinated chain of targeted proteins, it is presumed that the function of Uld is to provide a site for proteasome-mediated protein degradation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The general class of assay used for this variant effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation showed that these hydrogen bonds are important for keeping a stable spatial orientation of β3, because the mutation of Pro for Arg42 causes a large fluctuation in the structure of β3 strand with respect to the β5 strand and the α1 helix.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Basic controls and replicates were included for this assay.

assessment_steps.step_name: Sub-step 3c: Variant Controls
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The MD simulation showed that these hydrogen bonds are important for keeping a stable spatial orientation of β3, because the mutation of Pro for Arg42 causes a large fluctuation in the structure of β3 strand with respect to the β5 strand and the α1 helix.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Variant controls were not used in the assay for this variant.
assessment_steps.next_step_or_outcome: The functional evidence strength is Max PS3_supporting / Max BS3_supporting

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: The R42P mutation causes a large fluctuation of the β3 strand with respect to the β5 strand and the α1 helix, leading to the loss of the ability of Uld to trap the Rpn 10 subunit.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 1: Define the disease mechanism
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkin is the causative gene for the autosomal recessive form of Parkinson's disease (PD), and various deletion and point mutations in this gene have been discovered in patients with autosomal recessive juvenile Parkinsonism (AR-JP).
assessment_steps.reasoning: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Uld region in parkin has been reported to bind the Rpn10 subunit of the 26S proteasome. Because Rpn10 is a ubiquitinbinding domain for trapping the polyubiquitinated chain of targeted proteins, it is presumed that the function of Uld is to provide a site for proteasome-mediated protein degradation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The general class of assay used for this variant effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The results indicated that the backbone structure is little influenced by the mutation. The Lys48/Ala48 NH…O Phe45 pairs maintained the distance near to the range of hydrogen bond throughout the MD simulation, although the latter mutant pair shows the relatively large fluctuation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Basic controls and replicates were included for this assay.

assessment_steps.step_name: Sub-step 3c: Variant Controls
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The results indicated that the backbone structure is little influenced by the mutation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Variant controls were not used in the assay for this variant.
assessment_steps.next_step_or_outcome: The functional evidence strength is Max PS3_supporting / Max BS3_supporting

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: The K48A mutation has little effect on the β3-β4 loop structure, but the freely movable side chain of Lys48 is necessary for the interaction with the Rpn 10 subunit.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 1: Define the disease mechanism
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Parkin is the causative gene for the autosomal recessive form of Parkinson's disease (PD), and various deletion and point mutations in this gene have been discovered in patients with autosomal recessive juvenile Parkinsonism (AR-JP).
assessment_steps.reasoning: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Uld region in parkin has been reported to bind the Rpn10 subunit of the 26S proteasome. Because Rpn10 is a ubiquitinbinding domain for trapping the polyubiquitinated chain of targeted proteins, it is presumed that the function of Uld is to provide a site for proteasome-mediated protein degradation.
assessment_steps.reasoning: The general class of assay used for this variant effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Glu56 in the mutant restricts the motional flexibility between the α1-β2 loop and the α2 helix through the electrostatic interaction of Glu56 O ε1 …NH Ser19 pair.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Basic controls and replicates were included for this assay.

assessment_steps.step_name: Sub-step 3c: Variant Controls
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The Glu56 in the mutant restricts the motional flexibility between the α1-β2 loop and the α2 helix through the electrostatic interaction of Glu56 O ε1 …NH Ser19 pair.
assessment_steps.reasoning: Variant controls were not used in the assay for this variant.
assessment_steps.next_step_or_outcome: The functional evidence strength is Max PS3_supporting / Max BS3_supporting

functional_evidence_assessment.overall_conclusion: The V56E mutation restricts the motional flexibility of the short α2 helix and its periphery, which is necessary for the interaction with the Rpn 10 subunit.
